review_text:
I enjoyed a long getaway weekend in Mikeâ€™s bungalow. It was centrally located to the activities I had planned. (10 minutes to Lebanon Valley College, 20 minutes to Hershey.)
Mikeâ€™s bungalow is charming and cozy and includes all the essentials. It even includes a wireless phone charger, reclining chair and sofa, and a gas fireplace, which not only creates a nice ambience, but can heat the entire home.
Mike was very responsive and helpful when I had questions/concerns. I also appreciated Mikeâ€™s friendly neighbor who helped with the pilot light in the fireplace. Mike provided a basket of pamphlets which included menus and local attractions. Martinoâ€™s Italian Traditions is a highly recommended restaurant down the street! He also provided a binder complete with instructions, directions and maps. Very helpful. I enjoyed the fall foliage on the rail trail.
The bungalow is updated and nicely decorated. Mike is a great host. Highly recommended.
Thank you, Mike, for sharing your home.

Stayed about a week
review_text:
Five Stars for giving us such a great home-away-from-home experience.
The location was very convenient for our visits to Annville.
After visits in bustling areas we came home to an inviting cottage
with a lovely front porch and quiet, well-kept neighborhood which feels
peaceful and safe.
The home is very well lit and offers ample covered
driveway parking right by the front door. Very easy to use
keyless entry mechanism, too.
We found the bed comfortable and the living room restful.
The recliner sofa was especially appreciated.
The kitchen is full sized and fully equipped with nice dishware and new
appliances. Plus, the dishwasher and washer&dryer are very quiet.
You can run them and still enjoy the TV or sleep.
These hosts are readily available. On our one occasion to call them
our call was returned immediately.
In closing, we hope you can tell we found this place
a great vacation refuge!

It was much cheaper to stay here than anywhere in Hershey or Harrisburg. This was our first time anywhere in the area so we were not familiar with Myerstown. We loved it! Close to grocery stores. A perfect half way point to Strasburg, Hershey, Harrisburg and Reading which was perfect for us since we visited all of those. I got a message not too long before we arrived, that the pack n play was set up for us for our littlest one. Very nice we did not have to worry about that. They had plenty of board games and puzzles to keep our older kiddos busy. Also scooters and balls for outside. And we loved the devotions in the cabin to read to our kiddos, we took a picture to buy them for our home. We loved the no tv to have time together. We would definitely love to stay here again!

Our stay at the Country View Lodge was great! The lodge is beautiful and the location is lovely--wooded lot and quiet. What was especially appreciated on our rainy weekend was the fact that we could back right up to the garage door to unload and load our luggage because, with five ladies on a girls' weekend, there was a lot of luggage. There were fresh cookies waiting for us on the kitchen counter and juice drinks in the frig. The fireplace was delightful for the chilly, damp evenings. Overall the lodge is a great place to stay and we would highly recommend it! We would love to stay there again sometime when we could take advantage of the inviting firepit in the backyard. Thank you, Miriam, for responding so quickly any time I sent you a message and for providing such a lovely place to stay!
Sincerely,
Sandy P.

I have stayed at many wonderful Airbnbs, but even so, Miriam and her place were exceptional. We arrived at her place a day late after having had to pull over for the night during a terrible rainstorm. Miriam was very understanding and encouraging as we tried to navigate our arrival at the end of a long and difficult road trip. We arrived in the morning, somewhat the worse for wear, and found her place a beautiful, welcoming sanctuary.
The house is beautifully appointedâ€”she's thought of everything and it was very easy for our family to stretch out, feel comfortable, and rest. Lovely, peaceful neighborhood and property with a great porch, gorgeous trees, and a number of outdoor seating areas.
When we needed to extend our stay for a day, she was again flexible, accommodating, and gracious. It was a challenging weekend for us in several respects and Miriam's kind and thoughtful hospitality was a great blessing to us. I hope we have occasion to stay with her again. Highly recommend.

The bathrooms were nice and roomy stocked with plenty of towels,wash cloths, a few rolls of toilet paper. The beds were so comfy. We loved all of the decor as well as the lights through and around the property. There is a basket ball hoop, a lovely outdoor area with picnic tables and a fire pit.
Plenty of seating to be able to enjoy the surroundings. We saw quite a few horse and buggies pass by even while we drove. There was a folder that had local food recommendations and supermarkets near by. Hershey park was about 45 mins away but we enjoyed being away from
The city areas. The appliances gave a nice rustic touch. We did not want to leave. I would looove to stay here again soon.

review_text: I can't say enough positive things about Kyle and the Red Door Retreat. Our family had a wonderful, relaxing stay at the Red Door. My two kids (13 and 8) enjoyed the house so much that we ended up spending 2 of our 3 full days there just hanging out and enjoying the pool, hot tub, board games, and my son's favorite - the PacMan arcade game. They LOVED having the gumball machine and hot popcorn from the classic popcorn machine. The pool was the perfect size for my 8 year old to swim in circles or for all of us to just sit in and cool off. The hot tub was also a favorite. Everything was immaculately cleaned. The beds were super comfortable and there were so many thoughtful touches around the house that we didn't have to worry if we forgot to pack something. Kyle quickly responded to any questions we had and was incredibly gracious as well. We spent one day at Hershey Park which was an easy 30 minute drive away. Kyle had several suggestions of local places to visit that we were going to try out but we enjoyed the amenities at the house so much that we ended up hanging out there 2 of the days during our visit. You can't go wrong with booking this house. We look forward to visiting his other properties in the future as well.

This home was easily one of the best Airbnb experiences Iâ€™ve had. Hereâ€™s why:
1- The home is beautiful, immaculately kept, and well-stocked with everything from basic toiletries, kitchen supplies, and lots of supplies for children including play pens, board games, a popcorn machine, and a sâ€™mores kit.
2- Aside from all of the indoor amenities, including a tv in almost everyone room and a large tv to go with the oversized comfy couch, there is a spacious yard with a hot tub and a small pool. On cool April nights the hot tub was the perfect way to wind down after days taking kids out for the Hershey and Lancaster activities.
3- The home is centrally located between Hershey and Lancaster. There are tons of activities nearby, including Hershey Park, farm tours, and surprisingly good wineries and breweries.
4-Red Door Retreat is one of the most organized Airbnbs Iâ€™ve experienced. Kyle put together a wonderful App that has answers to every question you may have and recommendations for restaurants and activities. In addition, Kyle was a pleasure to communicate with and really went the extra mile to make sure we had all we needed every step of the way.

review_text: 5 out of 5 stars!!! Hands down THE best Airbnb home we have ever stayed at...and that is exactly what you get when you stay at Red Door Retreat...a home. 100% exceeded our expectations! I don't know what more I could possibily add to what everyone else has already said about Kyle's place but I feel he, his cleaning lady and Red Door Retreat deserve it! Walking into a warm, inviting and well lit home in the evening set the stage for our wonderful staycation. Not only does the list of amenities go on and on but the list of extra little things that you might not think of does as well. We did not want for anything!!! The oversized couch and board games were a huge hit! I highly recommend "Oodles" to anyone about 20 yrs or older...totally appropriate, a fun & hysterical walk down memory lane!! The well lit, fenced in, private backyard was fantastic! The quaint neighborhood with sidewalks was wonderful to walk our dog in. As for Kyle's cleaning lady....A+++++!!! Everything was cleaned & disinfected from top to bottom, it was spotless! I wish all cleaning companies were trained by you! ;) Kyle was always courteous, kind and helpful throughout our stay, a perfect host! I was excited to hear he has other listings! We are already figuring out when we will come back to Red Door Retreat! We highly recommend staying here to anyone! Thank you for the beautiful family memories made here!!

name: Joe
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2021
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
From the moment I booked this place until I checked out - the communication was awesome with the host. Always kind, courteous, and hospitable. I couldnt ask for anything more from the host. When my stay came up, driving up to the property, we came in late and it was inviting even walking up to the door, the property was in a nice neighborhood, well lit and walking in on a cold windy night we were greeted not by a property, or a rental but a home. It was a relief to get in there and get settled. You could tell right away the time, effort, and care that went in to preparing this place. There are so many little touches that made this place special and delight to stay in. Even for me and my family of my wife and three kids all under 7, everywhere you looked there were gentle touches the place was IMMACULATELY cleaned, there were no odors. Two of the beds were memory foam, another was spring, the linens were fresh, there was a washer dryer on prem. Now the home's age was on par for the neighborhood but this home had undergone a lot of updates. The house was beautiful, and charming. I had seen before where hosts would gussy up one part of the house then maybe half-ass another part - not the case here. Every square inch of the house had the same amount of love and attention, the back yard was a private oasis in an of itself. In a suburbia, it was well fenced in and private with the pool (closed as I visited in december), hot tub, I saw yard games on the side of the house, fire pit. So many thoughtful things - I could have spent my whole vacation just in this house (I had other plans already). Thoughout my vacation in the area my kids kept asking me "when are we going back to popcorn house?" in reference to the popcorn machine in the living room of Red Door Retreat. This house had everything we needed and could ask for. We did have a problem during our stay - one of my kids locked a door from the inside and closed it so I had to contact the host - the response was near instant and they came right by to open the door up. Very gracious and hospitable through and through. I cannot wait to check out other properties from this host, and if I ever venture to this area again I will be sure to check if Red Door Retreat is available again.
Book this place if you can, you wont regret it!

,

Stayed with kids
review_text:
Wow! What a nice place to get away. This home was spotless and we felt comfortable that new CDC cleaning guidelines were being followed.
Kyle's hospitality was top notch! The inside of the home is very nicely decorated with some really fun touches that my family enjoyed. The kitchen is well appointed and sparkling. The popcorn maker made movie night really special and the gumball machine kept the kids chewing!
The bedrooms are spacious and comfortable, and the upstairs bathroom was clean and very functional.
We spent a lot of time outside using the plunge pool and the lounging furniture. There's even a tiny garden! The fenced-in yard was perfect for our small dog, and the neighborhood is quaint and walkable and felt very safe.
Downtown Lebanon was not the highlight of our trip, but I would recommend Wertz's candy shop which was unique and well stocked, with everyone abiding by new covid regulations. The candy is all pre bagged to make it even safer!
Kayaking on the Swatara River through Cocoa Kayaks was a lot of fun too.
Kyle was great with all the communications making reservations, check in and check out seamless. The house is equipped with programmable locks making no keys necessary! Highly recommend!!

name: Janet
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2020
,
Â·
Group trip
review_text: As the decision maker for my family I am always afraid the I might not pick the best vacation location. I honestly research till I am exhausted. Well if you are like me stop, I will tell you that you cannot go wrong with the RED DOOR RETREAT. First Kyle is super detail oriented, so you do not have to chase him for door codes or set up because he tells you before you even ask. The house honestly is PERFECT. Kitchen has a great Keurig machine with both brew and k cup capabilities. The refrigerator, washing machine and dryer are modern appliances. He also has an ice making machine which is cool. All appliance are so clean. All utensil you can possibly needed. The bathroom has everything you need (ladies EVERYTHING) including a great shower head. The living has a great big TV with all the channels and subscriptions you can watch. The dining room is also very well set up and gorgeous. The Backyard has a great pool for cooling off and a fire pit perfect for the night. The grill is perfect, and he made sure the tanks where full and ready to use. I honestly can go on and on. The location is perfect. Don't second guess yourself book it. I honestly loved everything about this house.

The shower was small (as others noted) but the shower head is detachable so it wasnâ€™t a problem. There was a nice selection of various shampoos to use. The occasional road noise (that other reviews mentioned) was eliminated on our second night by using the window air conditioner. The bathroom nightlight was appreciated. The refrigerator was also nice to have - as was the coffee bar with a Keurig machine, coffee pods, mugs, etc. Also, it was convenient that the outlet between the beds had USB ports for phone charging. Finally, this is a very good location for enjoying the nearby walk/bike trail and for events at the Mount Hope Estate and Winery.

review_text: The space was very attractive and spacious, consisting of two separate living areas. The bedroom area was also the main living room with couches (yes, two), TV, and coffee table/end tables. The second living area was a couple of steps up to it from the main room and was another living room and a dining room. It included a good sized mini-fringe, microwave and Keurig coffee maker. But, with the lack of a kitchen, it seemed a bit odd to not have a kitchen itself (sink, etc). The two beds were very comfortable. The bathroom and stall shower were pristine in every way, though a tad small in space. I highly recommend that guests read the house rules and instructions in the notebook on a credenza in the main room. I pulled in late for my meeting with family and rushed out without being able to read it. The lock mechanism to lock it when you leave is not intuitive and not included in the email instructions

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Great visit, and a perfect place with kids! I'm always packing a million dumb little things to make life easier with a toddler - bath toys, stools for bathrooms, a big cup for rinsing hair in the bath, plastic plates and utensils. This place had all that! I never even unpacked my toy bag - my 4.5yo was delightfully occupied with the house toys. We're so bummed we never made it to the local creamery for ice cream but maybe we can make a second visit. Soft towels like you have at home, impeccably clean, and incredibly spacious. Even had leftover containers, which I NEVER find! We were 6 adults and a kid and the rooms were wonderful and comfortable. Convenient to Hershey Park, Chocolate World (the kid may still be on a sugar high), and Indian Echo Cavern if you're looking for something to do in the rain. I consider myself an experienced AirBNB'er, and this was one of my favorite places. I felt like I was staying at my own home. Seriously - this is the BEST place I've stayed with kids.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
We had a wonderful stay at Sheila & Darin's place! The location was perfect for us - tucked away from the city's hustle yet conveniently close to all necessities. It was a breeze getting to Hershey Chocolate World and Turkey Hill Experience, both just a 40-50min drive. The house itself was spacious and well-equipped, providing everything needed for a perfect getaway.
One of the highlights was undoubtedly the tranquility and connection with nature, all while being within reach of urban amenities. Sheila & Darin were exceptional hosts, making us feel truly special. Their homemade sourdough bread was a delightful touch!
Although we encountered a minor issue during our stay, Sheila and Darin's prompt response and resolution more than made up for it. As a family of 4 adults and 2 kids, we found the accommodations to be comfortable and inviting. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to others and stay ourselves when we visit this area again.
Thank you for a memorable experience!

We did ask for local recommendations and went to Patches for ice cream! It was a great recommendation. If I ever find myself in this area in the future I will not hesitate to stay here again. I highly recommend this property! Thank you, Amy for sharing your home with us!

We strongly encourage you to stay at the farm. You won't regret it. Also, make sure to check out Patches Creamery! Amy recommended this gem of a place to visit. It's just a 3-4 min drive away. Overall, we had a great time during in our stay at this beautiful home in Lebanon, PA and look forward to coming back at some pt in the near future!

review_text: Amy's place was beautiful from the time we pulled up until we did a full walkthrough through the house. Everything was neat and clean from the outside to the inside. There was plenty of space for our family of 12 to move around comfortably. Everyone especially enjoyed the basement, basketball hoop and the pool. We even appreciated the lack of televisions in the home. It allowed us to do what we came to do which was bond outside of electronics. The only complaints were about the beds. The mattresses definitely need to be updated. The bed that I slept in had the old school slacks that continuously slide out (middle slacks) which left me a little nervous about the mattress falling through (but it didn't). Also there is a bench outside that has a leg on it that has completely dry rotted. Other than those two things this home was perfect. Anyone staying here won't be disappointed. The home literally has everything that you'll need except for clothes and cooked food. Anything that you need can be found at the Walmart less than 15 minutes away.

review_text: I want to start by saying my bad review was not at all due to the cleanliness of the Airbnb, it was pretty clean by our standards. It was; 1. The bugs. They were swarming by the backdoor at all times days and night and when you opened the door they all rushed inside. So many flys and stuff flying around on the inside, landing on you all night. 2. Dampness. The basement floods regularly and there are no dehumidifiers in the house so it's very damp and the whole house has that damp basement smell. 3- There was a huge blood spot on the towel I used, I noticed after usage of course. 4-Finally, it was CREEPY. We are 3 grown men who have all served and seen combat and we were creeped out. the house is just creepy. from the dungeness basement to the "scary door" in the one bedroom, we honestly felt like we were being watched the whole time. Like I said, the place was clean by most standards. It was just literally everything else.

name: Kyra
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
January 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Janelle's place was very clean, cozy and easy to find. We had no problems our first two nights.
On our third night, my 9 year old son and I were returning to our rental late at night and 2 men were outside wandering around our rental and 1 man was inside our rental using his phone as a flashlight. All of our belongings were in there. They claimed they had a reservation, but when I called Janelle she said that no one else had a reservation. We felt extremely unsafe and got our things and left. I dont know if they had the code to get into the rental or if they broke in, but it was very unsettling and we were unable to stay our last night. We had to find somewhere else to stay at 12:30am and we were 3 hours from home. Janelle did refund us half of our payment, but I felt that this needed to be added to the review as it could have gone very badly if we happened to be inside and asleep.
I would recommend having the doors be more secure and changing the passcode before each new stay.
